triples.name: Data mining
triples.relevance: Data mining is the core methodology used to extract patterns from student data for predicting academic performance.

triples.name: Ensemble learning
triples.relevance: The paper proposes using ensemble classifiers as a novel approach to improve predictive accuracy for student performance.

triples.name: Decision tree learning
triples.relevance: Decision tree learning (J48) is one of the base classifiers used in the ensemble model for classification.

triples.name: Naive Bayes classifier
triples.relevance: Naive Bayes is one of the three base classifiers used in the ensemble approach for predicting student performance.

triples.name: Random forest
triples.relevance: Random Forest is the third base classifier used in the ensemble model to improve prediction accuracy.

triples.name: Association rule learning
triples.relevance: Association rule learning is used to identify rules that influence student academic outcomes from the data.

triples.name: Apriori algorithm
triples.relevance: Apriori is one of the rule-based techniques used for identifying association rules that affect student outcomes.

triples.name: Educational data mining
triples.relevance: Educational Data Mining is the specific domain and research field that this paper contributes to by predicting student performance.

triples.name: J48
triples.relevance: J48 is the specific implementation of decision tree learning used as one of the ensemble classifiers in this work.
